title: Walmart boycott: World's largest retailer tells protesters, 'we are America's ...'
content: Walmart is facing a week-long boycott, "Walmart Blackout," organized by People’s Union USA over DEI rollbacks and tax policies. Walmart defends its community contributions and economic impact, citing significant tax payments and charitable donations. Data suggests Walmart is more resilient to boycotts compared to Target, which experienced a larger impact from similar protests.

title: Small aircraft with two aboard crashes in upstate New York
content: A twin-engine Mitsubishi MU-2B aircraft crashed in a muddy field near Copake, upstate New York, on Saturday, with two people on board. The plane, en route to Columbia County Airport, went down approximately 30 miles away. First responders faced challenges reaching the site due to mud, weather, and snow, while the NTSB dispatched an investigation team.

title: Rubio to diplomats: Check Meta, X and other social media accounts of Visa applicants for ...
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has directed diplomats to intensify scrutiny of social media content for certain visa applicants, particularly students. This directive, outlined in a cable on March 25, aims to identify and bar individuals suspected of criticizing the United States or Israel.

title: Happy Baisakhi 2025: Best messages, quotes, wishes and images to share
content: Baisakhi, a vibrant harvest festival primarily celebrated in Punjab, marks the beginning of the harvest season and the Punjabi New Year. It holds deep spiritual significance for Sikhs, commemorating the creation of the Khalsa Panth by Guru Gobind Singh Ji. Celebrations include traditional dances, fairs, delicious food, and a spirit of gratitude, new beginnings, unity, and equality.

title: Jeff Bezos's dinner at Mar-a-Lago 'led' to Melania's Amazon project will also see Trump and Barron
content: Melania Trump has secured a $40 million deal with Amazon Prime Video for a documentary about her life during Donald Trump's anticipated White House return. Directed by Brett Ratner, the film will offer exclusive insights into her daily life and responsibilities as First Lady.

title: Jaat box office collection: Sunny Deol-starrer sees growth on its first Saturday
content: Sunny Deol's latest action drama, 'Jaat,' directed by Gopichand Malineni, has earned Rs. 26.50 crore after a 3-day run. The film, also starring Randeep Hooda as the antagonist, experienced a dip on its first Friday but rebounded on Saturday with Rs. 10 crore in collections. 'Jaat' features an ensemble cast and is receiving praise for both Deol and Hooda's performances.

title: Business jet owners wrestle with Mumbai airport over eviction notice
content: Mumbai airport asks them to shift, imposes ₹20 crore parking fee; BAOA says parking is an aeronautical service determined by the tariff regulator

title: Shivraj meets Bihar NDA leaders to plan for upcoming Assembly election
content: After the meeting, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary said that Nitish Kumar is the leader of NDA and will remain so in future as well.

title: New insemination technology to help boost income of dairy farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Animal Husbandry Department has performed 1,23,677 artificial inseminations and achieved a ratio of female and male calves of 91:9, says Andhra Pradesh Livestock Development Agency CEO

title: AIADMK will not compromise on State’s autonomy: Edappadi Palaniswami counters CM Stalin
content: Stalin was thunderstruck by the announcement of the AIADMK-BJP alliance, and released a statement when his panic was at the peak, Mr. Palaniswami said

title: Andhra Pradesh Govt. sanctions tariff subsidy of ₹4,471 crore to Discoms for Q1 of 2025-26
content: In a G.O. issued to that effect, the officer concerned has been directed to remit the advance claim into the bank accounts of the Discoms

title: Eight workers fell ill due to ammonia gas leak in Nellore
content: All were recovered and discharged on the same day, the company representatives told the TDP leaders who visited the shrimp processing plant in Ananthapuram village of TP Gudur mandal

title: Does Tahawwur Rana have links with Pakistan? | Explained
content: Will his extradition help India find a direct link between Pakistan and the Mumbai 26/11 terror case?

title: Calicut elevated to Archdiocese; Chakkalakal named Archbishop
content: Bishop Varghese Chakkalakal of the Diocese of Calicut will become the first Metropolitan Archbishop of the Archdiocese of Calicut

title: M. A. Baby | Congenial comrade
content: The newly elected General Secretary of the CPI(M) faces the tall task of unifying the fragmented Left, defining his party’s role within the INDIA bloc, and securing victory in Kerala Assembly polls

title: Watch: Who is Sadanand Date, the 26/11 hero now leading the Tahawwur Rana probe? | Pulse Maharashtra
content: From surviving a grenade blast in 26/11 to leading the probe against Tahawwur Rana, Sadanand Date’s journey comes full circle.

title: What has the SC ruled on the T.N. Governor? | Explained
content: What does the verdict say on R.N. Ravi’s refusal to give his assent to several Bills? What are the timelines set for both the Governor and the President? Does this give Opposition-ruled State governments a constitutional remedy against inordinate delays by Governors in clearing Bills?

title: Claim of over 50% as non-revenue water dubious: stakeholders
content: DCC raises concerns over the potential handover of KWA assets worth ₹3,000 crore and maintenance expenses of ₹1,000 crore per year

title: Abhishek Sharma creates history, slams highest IPL score by an Indian
content: Abhishek Sharma etched his name in IPL history with a blistering 141 off 55 balls, the highest individual score by an Indian in the league. His record-breaking innings powered Sunrisers Hyderabad to a successful chase of 246 against Punjab Kings.

title: Russian missile has hit warehouse of Indian pharma company, claims Ukraine
content: Amidst the ongoing conflict, a Russian missile struck the warehouse of Indian pharmaceutical company Kusum in Ukraine, according to the Ukrainian embassy in India. The embassy criticized Russia's actions as a deliberate attack on Indian businesses, destroying medicines intended for children and the elderly, despite claiming a special friendship with India.

title: Abhishek's 141-run mayhem rips apart Punjab Kings in record chase
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad orchestrated a stunning run-chase, securing an 8-wicket victory against Punjab Kings with 9 balls remaining. Abhishek Sharma's explosive 141 off 55 balls, supported by Travis Head's 66, propelled SRH to successfully chase down a daunting target of 246. Despite Punjab's strong batting performance led by Shreyas Iyer's 82, SRH's dominant batting display sealed the win.

title: 'This one is for Orange Army': Abhishek celebrates IPL hundred in style
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive maiden IPL century, a blistering 100 off 40 balls, powered Sunrisers Hyderabad against Punjab Kings. His knock, the third-fastest by an Indian in IPL history, featured a heartfelt dedication to the 'Orange Army.' Sharma's spectacular 171-run opening partnership with Travis Head set the stage for a crucial victory.

title: 'I thought …': Out-of-form Rishabh Pant reveals why he opened the innings
content: Rishabh Pant aims to overcome his batting slump by spending more time on the field. He scored 21 runs in the match against Gujarat Titans. Nicholas Pooran's impressive 61 runs helped Lucknow Super Giants win. Pant praised Pooran's game reading and batting skills. He also lauded his team's bowlers for their excellent performance.

title: 'Lapse in judgment': TN minister Ponmudy apologises for remarks on women
content: Tamil Nadu forest minister K Ponmudy apologized for his derogatory remarks against women and certain Hindu sects, acknowledging it as a lapse in judgment. The DMK removed him from his party position but not his ministerial post. DMK MP Kanimozhi and opposition leaders condemned his remarks, with calls for his removal from the government.

title: Shikhar's reel with rumoured girlfriend Sophie goes viral - Watch!
content: Shikhar Dhawan's Instagram reel featuring his rumoured Irish girlfriend, Sophie Shine, has gone viral, showcasing their playful chemistry in Punjabi attire. This comes after Dhawan hinted at moving on and being open to love again, fueling speculation about their relationship following joint appearances at recent events. Shine is an Irish product consultant and Second Vice President at Northern Trust Corporation.

title: Mohammed Shami records second worst bowling figures in IPL history
content: Mohammed Shami had a forgettable outing, conceding 75 runs in his four overs against Punjab Kings, the second-most expensive in IPL history. Marcus Stoinis's late onslaught, including four consecutive sixes in the final over, compounded Shami's woes. Shreyas Iyer's explosive 82 off 36 balls powered Punjab to a massive total, their second-highest ever in the IPL.

title: MHA likely to file review petition against SC verdict on Governor, President role in assenting to State laws
content: Petition challenging SC verdict being readied; officials claim the judgement paves the way to restore a lapsed Bill; court’s three-month timeline for President, Governor assent must be reconsidered, officials say

title: Russian missile strikes warehouse of Indian pharma firm in Ukraine, says Kyiv's mission in Delhi
content: The mission alleged that Moscow is deliberately targeting Indian businesses, destroying medicines meant for children and the elderly

title: Congress says Ahmedabad resolution a battle cry to defend democracy, asks cadre to take it to every home
content: The party also named 183 observers for Gujarat under the ‘Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan’, a campaign to build its organisation in the State

title: Putting Parandur on the radar
content: Early last week, in-principle approval was granted to the second airport at Parandur in Tamil Nadu. The airport will feature three midfield terminals, two parallel runways, and a handling capacity of 100 million passengers a year. Sunitha Sekar does a ground report on the multiple factors that are at play, as a massive infrastructure project gets under way. While the new airport is expected to raise the potential for Chennai, in terms of freight and passenger traffic, there are environmental and social justice concerns too

title: Deploy Central forces in Murshidabad, says Calcutta HC
content: They should work with West Bengal Police to restore normalcy, says Division Bench after three die in clashes and protests over Waqf law; six companies of BSF have already been deployed

title: BJP holds Mamata Banerjee responsible for “anti-Hindu violence” in West Bengal
content: BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari accused Mamata Banerjee of sending a message to extremist groups in the State that she was “supporting them,” following her opposition to Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Centre closely monitoring communal violence in West Bengal: Home Secretary
content: About 800 BSF personnel have been deployed in Murshidabad; Ministry of Home Affairs offers ‘all possible assistance’

title: WhatsApp down: Major outage hits messaging services globally
content: WhatsApp is currently experiencing a widespread disruption, impacting numerous users globally. Reports indicate that individuals are facing difficulties with sending messages, establishing connections, and utilizing call functionalities on both the mobile application and the web-based platform. Downdetector has registered a surge in user complaints, with a significant portion reporting issues specifically related to message transmission.

title: IPL 2025: Rohit Sharma’s knee heavily strapped on eve of match vs DC
content: Concerns rise for Mumbai Indians as Rohit Sharma's knee injury resurfaces ahead of their clash with Delhi Capitals. Sharma, seen with a knee brace and skipping net practice, previously missed a game due to the same issue. Despite playing against RCB, his recovery seems incomplete. His form is also a worry, averaging just 9.

title: Madhya Pradesh Police planning polygraph test on ‘fake’ cardiologist in Damoh
content: 2013 FIR against Narendra Yadav in Noida was also for using ‘forged’ documents for a job, say police; has had estranged relations with family since he started studying medicine back in 1991

title: Even the graves of NC leaders are protected by Central forces, says BJP
content: Schools are functional, businesses are thriving, and the people of J&K can feel the positive change, says Opposition leader Sunil Sharma; He accuses the NC leadership of failing to control the violence earlier

title: Mehbooba writes letters to Stalin, Mamata, Siddaramaiah; praises their stand on Waqf Act
content: The PDP chief says the Chief Ministers of T.N., West Bengal and Karnataka have upheld the inclusive and democratic idea of India

title: M.P. to launch new milk production policy on Ambedkar Jayanti, says CM
content: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav slammed Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for saying the BJP is making cowsheds because it likes the ‘stench’

title: HRF urges govt. to release Chilakaluripeta bus burning case convicts
content: Human Rights Forum cites a recent judgment of the A.P. High Court, which it says, allows grant of remission to the two convicts in the case, whose death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment in 1998 by the then President

title: First test flight of Saras Mk2 plane expected in December 2027: official
content: The Mk2 plane is an upgraded version of the 14-seater Saras prototype planes that were developed by CSIR-NAL; Hindustan Aeronautics Limited will be involved in the manufacturing

title: India, U.S. tri-service HADR exercise Tiger Triumph concludes on Eastern seaboard
content: According to the Indian Navy, the exercise marks a significant milestone in reinforcing the shared commitment of India and the United States towards regional stability, disaster response, and interoperability between their armed forces.

title: Work on new bypass in Ranipet kicks off
content: Four-lane stretch will come up between Tajpura and Veppur villages on Arcot-Villupuram High Road; it is expected to ease traffic in Arcot town

title: Malladi Vishnu holds TTD board responsible for cow deaths in Goshala
content: The YSRCP leader attributed it to lack of medical care, absence of veterinary staff, and poor nutrition

title: Anvar’s unconditional support will be crucial in Nilambur, says Satheesan
content: Aryadan Shoukath and V.S. Joy are the two prominent names currently considered for candidacy in Nilambur

title: Case registered against Jasna Saleem for filming at Guruvayur temple in violation of HC order
content: Incident has sparked debate over security protocols and enforcement of court directives at places of worship

title: In Bihar, liquor law is a tool to harass poor people, Dalits: Tejashwi Yadav
content: In the name of the liquor law, a parallel black money economy worth ₹40,000 crore has been established in Bihar, claims RJD leader; says Bihar police are using the ban for extortion and smuggling

title: Meitei group slams Kuki diktat against their annual pilgrimage to a sacred hill
content: Preventing us from visiting the sacred Thangjing Hill is like making Mecca out of bounds for Muslims, says Meitei foundation; Kuki groups say any attempt to cross the buffer zone would be seen as a “direct provocation”

title: Ballot box is mightier than a bullet: Venkaiah Naidu
content: Supporting Jamili elections, the former Vice-President advises the people to check the character, calibre, capacity and conduct of the leaders and not their caste, community, cash and criminal background

title: Southern Railway sanctions leave to loco pilot who rushed to help wife in labour
content: The All India Loco Running Staff Association condemned the denial of privilege leave to Mr. Bibin and sought the immediate intervention of the Southern Railway General Manager

title: Telangana model caste census in Bihar if voted to power: Jignesh Mevani
content: Ahead of Assembly election in Bihar, the Congress has given a push to its youth leaders including NSUI national in-charge Kanhaiya Kumar who conducted a foot march over the issue of migration and employment covering the entire State

title: Governor’s stance on Tamil Nadu case may pose new legal challenges to Kerala
content: Governor Rajendra Vishwanath  Arlekar has noted in a media interview that the Tamil Nadu case should have been referred to a Constitution Bench

title: Sheik Chinna Moulana’s centenary celebration draws to a close
content: A cash award of ₹25,000 each was presented to senior nadaswaram and thavil artistes V.P. Desabandhu and B. Murugapoopathi; a CD on Duraikannu Pillai, Chinna Moulana’s guru, released

title: The Hindu Civil Service Summit 2025 on May 9, 10
content: Aspirants can explore various course offerings, access preparation materials, and speak to mentors from India’s top-rated UPSC academies

title: Excise Minister Ravindra demands probe into YSRCP leader’s allegation on cow deaths in TTD Goshala
content: The unsubstantiated comments of former TTD Chairman Karunakar Reddy are a part of YSRCP president Jagan Mohan Reddy’s plan to damage the reputation of the institution, he says

title: Strict action against those resorting to unscientific medical treatments, says Kerala Helath Minister
content: Any regressive steps that undermine the State’s achievements in the health sector will be dealt with severely and treated as criminal offences, says Veena George

title: Bengaluru doctors take up ‘Liver Tech Study’ to assess prevalence of digital lifestyle-associated liver disease among IT professionals
content: Asserting that the incidence of Metabolic Dysfunction-Associated Steatotic Liver Disease has been increasing in epidemic proportions, doctors say IT workforce has all risk factors

title: Three teachers continue hunger strike outside School Service Commission office in Kolkata
content: The hunger strike comes in the aftermath of 26,000 people losing their jobs overnight after a Supreme Court order annulled the jobs of thousands of teaching and non-teaching staff in West Bengal government schools

title: Concern over TTD security as three devotees reach main entrance of Tirumala temple with footwear on
content: They pass through two highly guarded security barriers in the Vaikuntam Queue Complex, but are stopped at the Mahadwaram and advised to remove the footwear to proceed further

title: Rory seizes Masters lead, but Bryson just 2 back
content: Rory McIlroy will take a two-shot lead into the final round of the Masters, with Bryson DeChambeau hot on his heels after a furious finish Saturday.

title: Vols, Iamaleava split; 'no one bigger' than team
content: Tennessee is moving on from starting quarterback Nico Iamaleava, with sources telling ESPN that his decision to skip Friday's practice was a tipping point.

title: Ant available for Wolves' finale after T rescinded
content: The NBA rescinded the technical foul Anthony Edwards was issued in Minnesota's win Friday, which would have resulted in an automatic suspension for the Wolves' last game.

title: Reports: McKennie named in gambling probe
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie is among 13 soccer players being investigated for illegal online betting in Italy, according to widespread media reports.

title: Fan reaches into Trout's glove to snatch a catch
content: On Saturday night in Houston, in the right-field corner of Daikin Park, a fan grabbed the ball out of Mike Trout's glove after the Los Angeles Angels star reached into the right field stands to make what appeared to be a great catch against the Astros.

title: Gators celebrate title with 60K fans at the Swamp
content: The Florida Gators celebrated their recent basketball national championship in front of nearly 60,000 fans at the Swamp during halftime of football team's annual spring game.

title: 'Resilient' Stockton strengthens UGA QB1 status
content: Gunner Stockton, set to take over as Georgia's starting quarterback, played in the Bulldogs' spring game on Saturday, with coach Kirby Smart saying afterward that his biggest improvement is in "decision-making with his reads. I think he did a great job."

title: Celtics fill last roster spot with G League MVP
content: The Celtics are filling their final roster spot, converting G League MVP JD Davison to a standard two-year NBA contract, his agent told ESPN.

title: Everything at stake on the final day of the NBA regular season
content: The East bracket is set. The West's ... is not. Meanwhile, lottery races across the league will be decided Sunday.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Eastern Conference playoffs set
content: Tracking which teams have clinched for the playoffs with the 2024-25 NBA regular season nearing its conclusion.

title: 'Everybody in the organization was miserable': Inside the Nuggets' shocking dual firings
content: With less than a week left in the regular season, Denver fired its head coach and GM, ending a yearslong cold war, and risking the NBA's most precious commodity: the prime of three-time NBA MVP Nikola Jokic.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: Mock draft: Who comes after No. 1 Paige Bueckers?
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith, Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: Prince is a 6-7 center, but some GMs are apprehensive after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: Russian Missile Strikes Indian Pharma Firm's Kyiv Warehouse: Ukraine
content: A Russian missile struck the warehouse of an Indian pharmaceutical company in Kyiv, Ukraine said today. The country's embassy in India alleged Russia "deliberately" targeted Indian businesses in Ukraine.

title: 3 Killed In Bengal Waqf Protests, 5 More Border Force Companies Brought In
content: Three people were killed in West Bengal's Murshidabad district following violent clashes linked to ongoing protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act, the police said on Saturday.

title: "We Cannot Turn A Blind Eye": Calcutta High Court On Bengal Waqf Violence
content: Underlining that constitutional courts cannot be a mute spectator, the Calcutta High Court on Saturday ordered the deployment of Central forces in Bengal's Murshidabad where anti-Waqf protests have resulted in the death of three people.

title: Karnataka Caste Census Report Bats For Hiking OBC Reservation From 32% To 51%
content: The Karnataka caste census report which was presented before a cabinet meeting chaired by Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Friday recommended increasing reservation for Other Backward Classes (OBC) from 32 per cent to 51 per cent.

title: In 2-For-1 Deal, Alliance With AIADMK Also Strengthens BJP In Rajya Sabha
content: The renewed BJP-AIADMK alliance in Tamil Nadu also gives the former party a boost in numbers for the Rajya Sabha.

title: Woman Marries Against Family's Wishes, Father Dies By Suicide
content: A 49-year-old medical store owner who was reportedly distressed over his daughter "marrying against family's wishes" has died by suicide late Wednesday night in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior.

title: "Don't Play Victim": UK-Based Gangster Says He Gave Hit Order On Delhi Man
content: A gangster living in London has taken responsibility for the killing of a 52-year-old property dealer in Delhi. Rajkumar Dalal was driving his Toyota Fortuner when two cars approached from the side and opened fire at outer Delhi's Paschim Vihar.

title: Why All US Immigrants, H-1B Workers, Green Card Holders Must Carry ID 24x7
content: This directive, part of Trump's executive order 'Protecting the American People Against Invasion', went into effect on April 11 and aims to crack down on illegal immigration and deport millions living illegally.

title: IPL 2025: Abhishek Scripts Mammoth Record As SRH Rout PBKS By 8 Wickets
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Punjab Kings Highlights, IPL 2025: Abhishek Sharma played a record knock as SRH registered an easy eight-wicket win over PBKS.

title: Tamil Nadu Gets New BJP Chief, Day After Alliance Announced With AIADMK
content: The BJP on Saturday elected Nainar Nagenthiran as the President of its Tamil Nadu unit. Mr Nagendran, a three-time MLA from Tirunelveli, replaces K Annamalai in the top job.

title: Om Birla Keeps Vow, Performs Ritual At Wedding Of Pulwama Hero's Daughter
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, fulfilling a promise he had made six years ago, attended the wedding ceremony of a Pulwama martyr's daughter in Rajasthan's Kota, assuming the role of a brother to the bride's mother.

title: Watch: Shreyas Iyer Left Fuming At Punjab Kings Teammate Over DRS Call vs SRH
content: Shreyas Iyer was left agitated at his team during the Sunrisers Hyderabad vs Punjab Kings game in IPL 2025.

title: Legs Tied, Nails Pulled Out: Bear Tortured To Death, Video Shared Online
content: A horrific video of cruelty against animals has surfaced on social media and gone viral. The incident involving a bear was reported from Chhattisgarh's Sukma district.

title: Martinelli: Nørgaard 'could have broken my leg'
content: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has said Christian Nørgaard "could have broken my leg" and should have been sent off for a late tackle in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Brentford.

title: Bayern held by Dortmund to keep title race alive
content: Borussia Dortmund prevented Bayern Munich from going eight points clear in the Bundesliga on Saturday by fighting back for a 2-2 draw in "der Klassiker."

title: Atlético fans: We'll sue UEFA over Álvarez UCL pen
content: Four Atlético Madrid fan groups have said they will take legal action against UEFA over Julián Álvarez's disallowed penalty in the Champions League.

title: Wrexham's 0-0 draw narrows promotion picture
content: Wrexham's automatic promotion hopes took a hit on Saturday as they played out a goalless draw with Wigan Athletic.

title: Newcastle boss Howe in hospital, to miss Man Utd
content: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe has been hospitalised and will miss Sunday's game against Manchester United, the Premier League club have confirmed.

title: Pep hails departing KDB after rout: 'Incredible'
content: Pep Guardiola has admitted that no player can replicate the "incredible" Kevin De Bruyne after the departing Manchester City midfielder starred in the 5-2 win over Crystal Palace on Saturday.

title: How BU, Western Michigan got to title game and what it will take to win it
content: The Terriers and Broncos play for the national championship in men's hockey. Here's a look at each team.

title: Hamilton 'sorry' as Ferrari struggles continue
content: Lewis Hamilton was dejected after qualifying ninth, saying "it's definitely not a good feeling for sure."

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Daly hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Bernhard Langer's last supper
content: The 67-year-old finished one stroke outside the cut line at his 41st and final Masters, capping off a career that spanned eras.

title: With Flacco signing, Browns in position to forgo drafting QB at No. 2
content: With Flacco back in the fold, the Browns have a veteran quarterback on the roster whom they can trust to run the offense in 2025.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eyeing move for Cherki
content: Man United are reportedly looking at a possible deal to sign Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Malik Beasley disagrees with Giannis Antetokounmpo's shimmy after late-game block
content: The Pistons guard took his frustration to social media after the Bucks forward performed his signature celebration.

title: Delhi Chief Minister Sees Man Feeding Roti To Cow On Busy Road. Does This
content: Ms Gupta posted the video of her interaction with the man on X and requested Delhiites not to throw 'roti' or any food on the road.

title: Are Tatkal Ticket Booking Timings Changing? Indian Railways Clarifies
content: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) has issued a clarification amid recent reports of change in Tatkal ticket booking timings.

title: India, 61 countries agree to world's 1st global carbon tax in shipping industry
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India’s position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. title: Wetzel: House settlement officially ends college amateurism, and good riddance

title: Rockies' new City Connect uniforms capture the colors of Colorado's skies
